Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Greatly \Great"ly\, adv. 1. In a great degree; much. [1913 Webster]
I will greatly multiply thy sorrow. --Gen. iii. 16. [1913 Webster]
2. Nobly; illustriously; magnanimously. [1913 Webster]
By a high fate thou greatly didst expire. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
greatly adv : to a great extent or degree; "he improved greatly"; "greatly reduced"
